reflections.text: Designing this journal helped me understand how frontend and backend connect cleanly.
reflections.name: Harka
reflections.details: This project made me realize the importance of clear communication between frontend and backend. I reflected on how API design impacts UI rendering and data consistency. I also noted areas for optimization in data fetching and state management. Overall, this reflection deepened my full-stack understanding and development workflow.

reflections.text: Glass UI feels modern and calm. Performance matters as much as visuals.
reflections.name: Harka
reflections.details: While implementing glassmorphism, I reflected on balancing aesthetics and performance. Smooth animations improved the user experience without overloading resources. I also learned to use CSS variables and gradients effectively. This reflection reinforced the importance of clean, performant UI design. I now appreciate subtle design choices that enhance user engagement.

reflections.text: Implementing the theme toggle taught me the importance of user preferences and persistence.
reflections.name: Harka
reflections.details: Adding a theme toggle allowed me to consider user customization seriously. I implemented localStorage to persist preferences across sessions. This reflection helped me understand UX consistency and personalization. I also tested how toggling affects different components and animations. I learned that small features significantly improve user satisfaction.

reflections.text: Mobile-first design challenged me to think about responsive layouts and touch interactions.
reflections.name: Harka
reflections.details: Designing for mobile first forced me to prioritize content hierarchy and usability. Touch interactions required careful placement of buttons and scroll behaviors. I reflected on accessibility and device compatibility. This experience highlighted the importance of testing on multiple screen sizes. Overall, mobile-first thinking improved both design quality and responsiveness.

reflections.text: Adding animations made me realize subtle movements improve the overall UX without overwhelming users.
reflections.name: Harka
reflections.details: I experimented with scroll animations and transitions to make the site feel lively. Reflection showed me that small, smooth motions enhance user focus and engagement. I also learned not to overdo animations to avoid distraction. Testing timing and easing was important for balance. This reflection reinforced the principle of thoughtful, minimalistic motion design.

reflections.text: Saving and fetching JSON data from the backend strengthened my understanding of state management.
reflections.name: Harka
reflections.details: I reflected on how data persistence affects user experience and application reliability. Fetching and saving JSON taught me about asynchronous JS patterns and error handling. I realized the importance of consistent data structures for future scalability. This reflection improved my approach to state management and API design. Overall, it gave me confidence in handling dynamic data-driven projects.

reflections.text: Testing the Snake game across devices highlighted the importance of flexible controls and accessibility.
reflections.name: Harka
reflections.details: Through testing, I observed differences in touch and keyboard interactions. I adjusted control sensitivity and layout for accessibility. Reflection emphasized user testing as a key part of development. I also noted improvements for performance and responsiveness. This reinforced the value of designing with diverse users in mind.
